intro: Meliosma pinnata subsp. pinnata, commonly known as the broadleaf meliosma, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its simple, alternate, and often ovate to elliptical leaves that are usually pubescent on the underside. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments. The leaves are used in traditional medicine for their purported therapeutic properties.
